sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, and other EU leaders, the Belgian and Dutch Prime Ministers Alexander de Kroo and Mark Rutte, made an impromptu meeting with farmers' unions on the sidelines of the EU summit in Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Earlier that morning, over a thousand tractors showed up outside the European Parliament, where angry farmers set bales of hay on fire and toppled a bronze statue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Protesting farmers across Europe demand more income.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: They're also critical of the EU's Green Deal policy to protect the planet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We had a very constructive, a very good meeting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We listened to the main complaints and worries and concerns of the farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It's very important that we find common solutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We share the goals, for example the protection of nature, because we all live in nature and with nature, and the best ambassadors for nature are the farmers themselves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Farmers also complain about severe administrative burdens brought about by the EU's Common Agricultural Policy. They also complain about low prices for grain and wheat. Prime Minister of Belgium Alexander de Kroo says the current Belgian EU presidency is putting this issue high on the agenda.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Alexander de Kroo, Prime Minister of Belgium What we see is they want to be a partner in the climate transition. They've done a lot of efforts up to now, but obviously they are confronted with what you could call a lasagna of measures that all come at the same time." In addition, farmers have concerns about the EU's future trade deals with South America in particular, which according to them, would facilitate beef imports from countries with lower regulatory standards.
